description:
The large horse chestnut tree (T1) in the front garden of 68 Cambridge Road, with branches overhanging the pavement. The plan is to carry out a 30% crown thinning and reduction to reduce overhang over the public pavement and also create a uniform shape of the crown.

Current canopy (crown) diameter: 13.5 meters -Current crown height: 14.5 meters.
Proposed Works:
Crown reduction of 2 meters on each side (total 4 meters reduction in diameter), Crown height reduction of 4 meters.
Post-Reduction Dimensions:
Final canopy spread: 9.5 meters in diameter, Final crown height: 10.5 meters.
decision_conditions: The specification is not suitable and therefore needs to be confirmed. The specification needs to be measurable and quantifiable so that we can understand the amount that is to be removed in meters. We need to know the amount to be removed and the remaining crown size. E.g. 2m crown reduction in width and 2m reduction in height, leaving a canopy spread of 3m and height of 5m
